experimentïƒ

This module have all function for initiating pipeline and training

get_path(of, pplid=None, epoch=None)[source]ïƒ

Generate a standardized file path for various experiment artifacts.

Constructs and returns a file path based on the type of file (of), experiment ID, epoch number, and batch index, where applicable. Automatically creates necessary directories if they do not exist.

Parameters:

  • of (str) â€“ The type of file to retrieve the path for. Supported values: - â€œconfigâ€: Configuration file path. - â€œweightâ€: Model weights file path. - â€œgradientâ€: Saved gradients file path. - â€œhistoryâ€: Training history file path. - â€œquickâ€: Quick config file path.

  • pplid (str, optional) â€“ Experiment ID. If not provided, uses the currently set self.pplid.

  • epoch (int, optional) â€“ Epoch number. Required for weight and gradient file paths. For weights, if not specified, the best epoch from config is used.

  • batch (int, optional) â€“ Batch index, required for gradient file paths.

Returns:

Full path to the specified artifact as a string with forward slashes.

Return type:

str

Raises:

ValueError â€“ If pplid is not set or invalid. If required parameters (epoch, batch) are missing for gradient paths. If the of argument is not one of the supported values.

load(pplid, prepare=False)[source]ïƒ

Load the experiment configuration and optionally prepare the pipeline.

Retrieves the configuration file associated with the given experiment ID and sets it as the active configuration. Optionally, prepares the pipeline using the loaded settings (e.g., model, data loaders, etc.).

Parameters:

  • pplid (str) â€“ The experiment ID whose configuration is to be loaded.

  • prepare (bool, optional) â€“ Whether to immediately prepare the pipeline using the loaded configuration. Defaults to False.

Raises:

  • ValueError â€“ If the provided experiment ID does not exist in the experiment database.

  • Side Effects â€“

  • ------------ â€“

  • - Sets self.cnfg with the loaded configuration dictionary. â€“

  • - Updates self.pplid to the provided experiment ID. â€“

  • - Calls self.prepare() if prepare is True. â€“

Return type:

None

load_model(epoch=None)[source]ïƒ

Load model weights from disk into the model component for a specified epoch.

If epoch is set to â€˜lastâ€™ or â€˜bestâ€™, the corresponding epoch value from the experiment configuration is used. If the epoch is 0 and no weights exist yet, the modelâ€™s current state is saved before loading. Weights are loaded with strict=False to allow partial loading of the model.

Parameters:

epoch (int or str, optional) â€“ The epoch number or keyword (â€˜lastâ€™ or â€˜bestâ€™) indicating which weights to load. - â€˜lastâ€™: Loads the most recent training checkpoint. - â€˜bestâ€™: Loads the checkpoint with the best validation performance. - int: Loads the checkpoint from the specified epoch. - None: Defaults to using the current epoch from config if available.

Returns:

The model component with the loaded weights.

Return type:

torch.nn.Module

Raises:

ValueError â€“ If the experiment configuration or weight file path is invalid or missing.

Notes

  • Uses torch.load(â€¦, weights_only=True) for loading weights.

  • Uses strict=False in load_state_dict to allow for minor mismatches.

  • Automatically saves the model if the requested epoch is 0 and no checkpoint exists.

new(pplid=None, args=None, prepare=False)[source]ïƒ

Create a new experiment configuration and initialize its tracking files.

Parameters:

  • pplid (str, optional) â€“ Unique experiment identifier. Raises ValueError if it already exists.

  • args (dict, optional) â€“ Configuration arguments for the experiment.

  • prepare (bool, optional) â€“ If True, calls self.prepare() after creation. Defaults to False.

Raises:

  • ValueError â€“ If the experiment ID already exists or if monitor mode is invalid.

  • KeyError â€“ If â€˜metricsâ€™ key is missing from settings.

  • Behavior â€“

  • -------- â€“

  • - Checks if the experiment ID already exists; raises an error if so. â€“

  • - Checks if the same configuration already exists using verify. â€“

  • - Initializes configuration dictionary with metadata. â€“

  • - Saves the configuration. â€“

  • - Creates an empty history CSV with columns for training and validation metrics and loss. â€“

  • - Initializes quick checkpoint file with default best and last epoch metrics. â€“

  • - Appends experiment metadata to the main experiments CSV. â€“

  • - Optionally calls self.prepare() if prepare=True. â€“

Return type:

None

prepare()[source]ïƒ

Prepare the experiment by loading model, optimizer, metrics, loss, and data loaders.

Loads components according to current configuration, initializes data loaders, and sets the best metric value based on the stored history and strategy.

Raises:

  • ValueError â€“ If strategy monitor mode is not â€˜minâ€™ or â€˜maxâ€™.

  • Behavior â€“

  • -------- â€“

  • - Loads model and moves it to device. â€“

  • - Loads optimizer with model parameters. â€“

  • - Loads metrics and loss functions to device. â€“

  • - Creates training and validation data loaders. â€“

  • - Loads last saved model weights. â€“

  • - Initializes the best metric value from saved checkpoints or sets default. â€“

  • - Sets internal flag _prepared to True on success. â€“

Return type:

None

property should_runningïƒ
stop_running()[source]ïƒ
sync()[source]ïƒ

Synchronize and update the experiment configuration with the latest quick settings.

Loads the quick configuration file associated with the current experiment ID, updates the main configuration (self.cnfg) with its contents, and then saves the updated configuration to disk.

Side Effectsïƒ

  • Modifies the self.cnfg attribute by merging it with the quick configuration.

  • Writes the updated configuration to the config file.

  • Prints a success message indicating the experiment has been synced.

raises ValueError:

If the current arguments do not match the original configuration, preventing saving.

Return type:

None

train(num_epochs=5, self_patience=None, verbose=None)[source]ïƒ

Train the model for a specified number of epochs with optional early stopping.

Parameters:

  • num_epochs (int, optional) â€“ Number of epochs to train. Default is 5.

  • self_patience (int, optional) â€“ Number of epochs to wait for improvement before early stopping. If None, equals num_epochs.

  • verbose (list of str or str, optional) â€“ Metrics to display live during training. Must be from the set of defined metrics.

Return type:

None

Notes

  • Uses early stopping based on the configured strategy and patience.

  • Automatically resumes from last epoch.

  • Saves best model weights and updates training history.

  • Avoids re-entrance if training is already running.

update(data)[source]ïƒ

Update the pipeline configuration and save state after an epoch.

Parameters:

data (dict) â€“ Dictionary containing keys such as â€˜epochâ€™, â€˜train_accuracyâ€™, â€˜train_lossâ€™, â€˜val_accuracyâ€™, â€˜val_lossâ€™, and potentially other metrics and durations.

Returns:

Returns True if the current epochâ€™s validation metric improves over the best recorded, triggering a best model save; otherwise, False.

Return type:

bool

Notes

  • Saves model weights after every epoch.

  • Appends training and validation metrics to the history CSV.

  • Updates the quick checkpoint file with last and best metrics.

verify(*, pplid=None, args=None)[source]ïƒ

Check whether a given experiment ID exists in the experiment database.

Queries the experiments table to verify whether the specified experiment ID is recorded.

Parameters:

  • pplid (str) â€“ The experiment ID to check.

  • args (Dict | None)

Returns:

Returns the pplid if it exists in the database, otherwise returns False.

Return type:

Union[str, bool]

Examples

>>> pipeline.verify("exp_001")
'exp_001'

>>> pipeline.verify("nonexistent_exp")
False

  • ppls (List[str] | None)

Raises:

ValueError â€“ If any pipeline ID or metric name is invalid.:

dict[str, pd.DataFrame] â€“ epoch and selected metrics history.

group_by_common_columns(records)[source]ïƒ

Group pipeline records by their common set of DataFrame columns.

Parameters:

  • (dict) (records) â€“ (e.g., training histories with various metrics).

  • records (Dict[str, DataFrame])

Returns:

dict â€“ pipeline IDs sharing that column structure.

Return type:

A dictionary mapping each unique set of column names (as a frozenset) to a list of

Example

>>> records = {
...     "exp1": pd.DataFrame(columns=["epoch", "train_loss", "val_loss"]),
...     "exp2": pd.DataFrame(columns=["epoch", "train_loss", "val_loss"]),
...     "exp3": pd.DataFrame(columns=["epoch", "accuracy", "val_accuracy"])
... }
>>> group_by_common_columns(records)
{
    frozenset({'epoch', 'train_loss', 'val_loss'}): ['exp1', 'exp2'],
    frozenset({'epoch', 'accuracy', 'val_accuracy'}): ['exp3']
}
multi_train(ppls, last_epoch=10, patience=5)[source]ïƒ

Train multiple pipelines up to a maximum number of epochs with optional patience.

Parameters:

  • ppls (dict[str, int]) â€“ Dictionary of pipeline IDs to some integer values (usage unclear).

  • last_epoch (int, optional) â€“ Maximum number of epochs to train each pipeline, by default 10.

  • patience (int, optional) â€“ Number of epochs to wait for improvement before stopping (currently unused), by default 5.

Raises:

ValueError â€“ If any pipeline ID in ppls is not found in the existing pipelines.

Return type:

None

plot_metrics(ppls=None, of=None, metrics=None, args=None)[source]ïƒ

Plot specified metrics for one or more pipelines over training epochs.

Parameters:

  • ppls (list of str or None, optional) â€“ List of pipeline IDs to plot. If None, plots all pipelines.

  • metrics (list of str or None, optional) â€“ List of metrics to plot. If None, plots all available metrics in the histories.

  • args (Dict | None)

Returns:

Dictionary mapping metric names to their corresponding matplotlib Axes objects.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

ValueError â€“ If any pipeline ID in ppls is invalid. If any metric in metrics is invalid.

Notes

This function groups pipelines by common metric columns and plots each metric across all pipelines sharing that metric. The returned Axes can be further customized.

transfer_ppl(ppls, transfer_type='export', mode='copy', env=True)[source]ïƒ

Transfers pipeline data between main storage and transfer folder.

Parameters:

  • (list[str]) (ppls)

  • (str (mode) â€“ â€˜exportâ€™ moves data from main storage to transfer folder, â€˜importâ€™ moves data from transfer folder back to main storage.

  • optional) (Transfer mode, either 'copy' (default) or 'move'.) â€“ â€˜exportâ€™ moves data from main storage to transfer folder, â€˜importâ€™ moves data from transfer folder back to main storage.

  • (str â€“ â€˜copyâ€™ duplicates files, â€˜moveâ€™ relocates files.

  • optional) â€“ â€˜copyâ€™ duplicates files, â€˜moveâ€™ relocates files.

  • ppls (List[str])

  • transfer_type (str)

  • mode (str)

Raises:

ValueError â€“ If transfer_type or mode is invalid,: or if any pipeline ID is not found in the source records.
